File libsrc/libmath/euler.c

Routines for computing coordinates in a rotated coordinate system and the rotation matrix.

Public Function Index

euler (double *, double *, double, double, double)
Compute rotated coordinates.
euler2 (double *, double *, double, double, double, double, double, double)
Do two sets of euler angle rotations.
rotation_matrix (double, double, double, double)
Compute the rotation matrix.

Public Functions

euler 
 void euler(double *theta,
            double *phi,
            double a,
            double b,
            double g)
Compute rotated coordinates. Compute the coordinates corresponding to the input theta,phi in a coordinate system rotated by Euler angles alpha,beta,gamma with respect to the original system. (see Edmonds p7 and p53) Input theta,phi,a,b,g in radians.

Returns:
values for theta: 0. to PI, and for phi: -PI to PI.
euler2 
 void euler2(double *theta,
             double *phi,
             double a1,
             double b1,
             double g1,
             double a2,
             double b2,
             double g2)
Do two sets of euler angle rotations. This is useful when rotation angle are always defined with respect to the original coordinate system, and you therefore need to unrotate before rotating with the new angles.

Rotate theta0, phi0 with alpha, beta, gamma: 

  euler(&theta0, &phi0, alpha, beta, gamma);
Rotate the new theta0, phi0 using alpha2, beta2, gamma2 with respect to the original system. 
  euler2(&theta0, &phi0, -gamma, -beta, -alpha, alpha2, beta2, gamma2);
rotation_matrix 
 void rotation_matrix(double alpha,
                      double beta,
                      double gamma,
                      double c[3][3])
Compute the rotation matrix. Compute the rotation matrix corresponding to the three Euler angles.
